org.peertrust.tnviz.app
Class TNTreeDiagramm

java.lang.Object
  org.peertrust.tnviz.app.TNTreeDiagramm

public class TNTreeDiagramm
extends java.lang.Object

The TNTreeDiagramm class provides the means to create and maintain a tree diagramm. It is being used by the TNGraphics class in order to visualize the tree of queries and answers.

$Id: TNTreeDiagramm.html,v 1.3 2006/09/20 15:25:09 jldecoi Exp $
Date: 10-Feb-2005
Last changed: $Date: 2006/09/20 15:25:09 $ by $Author: jldecoi $

Author:
Michael Schaefer and Sebastian Wittler

TNTreeDiagramm

public TNTreeDiagramm(Graphics graphics)

Method Detail

wipeGraph

public void wipeGraph()
Cleans the graph by creating a new graph object and by resetting status information like graphPath and graphElements.

addQuery

public void addQuery(Query query)
Adds a query. The query information is being read out and new nodes and edges are created according to the sequence diagramm structure.

Parameters:
query - The new query.

addAnswer

public void addAnswer(Answer answer)
Adds an answer. The answer information is being read out and new nodes and edges are created according to the sequence diagramm structure.

Parameters:
answer - The new answer.

                                    int y,
                                    long reqQueryId,
                                    java.lang.String peerAddress,
                                    java.lang.String peerAlias,
                                    int peerPort)
Creates a new node with the given information.

Parameters:
object - The label object.
x - The x-position in pixels.
y - The y-position in pixels.
reQueryId - The reqQueryId.
peerAddress - The peer address.
peerAlias - The peer alias.
peerPort - The peer port.
Returns:
The id of the new node.

connectNodes

private java.lang.String connectNodes(java.lang.String nodeSource,
                                      java.lang.String nodeTarget,
                                      java.lang.Object object,
                                      java.lang.String goal,
                                      long reqQueryId,
                                      boolean query,
                                      boolean answer,
                                      int status,
                                      java.lang.String proof)
Connects the two nodes with the given ids with a new edge with the given information. For this purpose, new invisible nodes and new visible edges are being created to construct the sequence diagramm structure.

Parameters:
nodeSource - The id of the source node.
nodeTarget - The id of the target node.
object - The label object.
goal - The goal.
reqQueryId - The reqQueryId.
query - True, if the connection represents a query, otherwise false.
answer - True, if the connection represents an answer, otherwise false.
status - The status.
proof - The proof.
Returns:
The id of the new edge.

connectNodes

private java.lang.String connectNodes(TNNode nodeSource,
                                      TNNode nodeTarget,
                                      java.lang.Object object,
                                      java.lang.String goal,
                                      long reqQueryId,
                                      boolean query,
                                      boolean answer,
                                      int status,
                                      java.lang.String proof)
Connects the two given nodes with a new edge with the given information. For this purpose, new invisible nodes and new visible edges are being created to construct the sequence diagramm structure.

Parameters:
nodeSource - The source node.
nodeTarget - The target node.
object - The label object.
goal - The goal.
reqQueryId - The reqQueryId.
query - True, if the connection represents a query, otherwise false.
answer - True, if the connection represents an answer, otherwise false.
status - The status.
proof - The proof.
Returns:
The id of the new edge.

getGraph

public org.jgraph.JGraph getGraph()
Returns the JGraph object on which this diagramm is operating.

Returns:
The JGraph object.

refreshGraph

public void refreshGraph()
Refreshed the graphs. Should be called after changes were made.

getGraphElements

public java.util.Hashtable getGraphElements()
Returns a hashtable with all graph elements. The keys are the ids of the elements, the value the according objects.

Returns:
A hashtable with the graph elements.

setGraphElements

public void setGraphElements(java.util.Hashtable graphElements)
Sets the graph elements to the given hashtable.

Parameters:
graphElements - The new graph elements table.

getGraphPath

public java.util.Vector getGraphPath()
Returns the graphPath of this diagramm. The graphPath vector contains the graph elements in the order in which they were created. Additional graph elements which were automatically created for the structure of the diagramm are not included.

Returns:
A vector with the graph elements.

setGraphPath

public void setGraphPath(java.util.Vector graphPath)
Sets the graphPath to the given vector.

Parameters:
graphPath - The new graphPath.

Returns an array of indices which represent the different depth tree levels. return int[] Beginning-Indices of depth levels.
